intro: Rhabdia crebrifolia, commonly known as the dense-leaved rhabdia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its dense foliage and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture, while the stems are often woody and branched. Rhabdia crebrifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
